How an election-packed 2024 could swing world marketsCountries making up over 60% of the world's economic output and more than half of its population hold elections this year. To old friend in Iowa, Xi says world requires stability in China-US tiesChinese President Xi Jinping, in a recent reply to a letter from an Iowa native whom he first met nearly four decades ago, said the world's future demanded stability in Sino-U.S. ties, according to Chinese state media on Wednesday. Wed, 10 Jan 2024 05:57:27 GMT C6NSGFJ6XBPRNETY2G5EXCNHWQ https://www.reuters.com/world/old-friend-iowa-xi-says-world-requires-stability-china-us-ties-2024-01-10/Ryan Woo世界
German train drivers start 3-day strike, bringing rail travel to near haltGerman commuters face train cancellations across the country from Wednesday, as a three-day nationwide rail strike adds to travel chaos in Europe's largest economy, where ongoing farmers' protests have also snarled road traffic. Wed, 10 Jan 2024 05:47:31 GMT YVRXVLIYPFNALG6E7AAEMBEA2E https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/german-train-drivers-start-3-day-strike-bringing-rail-travel-near-halt-2024-01-10/Reuters商业汽车与交通

Liberal PDP wins parliamentary elections in Bhutan - provisional vote tallyA liberal political party led by a former prime minister was set to form a new government in Bhutan after winning its fourth free vote since democratic elections began 15 years ago, provisional results by the country's election body showed on Wednesday.
